publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3528 Brian Adam: Supermarket Buying Power—That the Parliament expresses concern about the growing buying power of the major supermarkets and the impact this has on the food production and processing industries in Scotland; endorses the growing movement amongst dairy farmers to redress the situation; notes that this concern is shared by other sectors, including fish processors, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make appropriate representations to the Office of Fair Trading.

S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Stewart Stevenson*, Richard Lochhead*, Rob Gibson*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Eleanor Scott*, Robin Harper*, Tommy Sheridan*, Fergus Ewing*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Jim Mather*, Mr Andrew Welsh*
S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Mr Andrew Arbuckle*, Patrick Harvie*, Chris Ballance*
S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Alex Fergusson*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Bill Aitken*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, John Scott*

S2M-3528 Brian Adam: Supermarket Buying Power—That the Parliament expresses concern about the growing buying power of the major supermarkets and the impact this has on the food production and processing industries in Scotland; endorses the growing movement amongst dairy farmers to redress the situation; notes that this concern is shared by other sectors, including fish processors, and calls on the Scottish Executive to make appropriate representations to the Office of Fair Trading. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Richard Lochhead, Rob Gibson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Eleanor Scott, Robin Harper, Tommy Sheridan, Fergus Ewing, Roseanna Cunningham, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Adam Ingram, Jim Mather, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Andrew Arbuckle, Patrick Harvie, Chris Ballance, Alex Fergusson, Mr Mark Ruskell, Bill Aitken, Donald Gorrie, Mr Ted Brocklebank, John Scott, Phil Gallie*, Shiona Baird*, Mark Ballard*, Mike Pringle*, Murray Tosh*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Murdo Fraser*, Mr David Davidson*, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Mrs Nanette Milne*
S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Ms Sandra White*, John Swinburne*
S2M-3528 Supermarket Buying Power (lodged on 7 November 2005) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr John Swinney*
